newsitem.title: USA: Goldman in deal to acquire asset management firm.
newsitem.headline: Goldman in deal to acquire asset management firm.

text.p: Goldman Sachs & Co said it reached an agreement to acquire Liberty Investment Management, a Tampa, Florida based investment advisory firm with about $5.4 billion in assets under management.
Goldman said Liberty Investment will merge into its Goldman Sachs Asset Management division. Terms of the acquisition were not disclosed.
Goldman said Liberty's owner and chief executive Herbert Ehlers agreed to invest "a significant portion of his transaction proceeds" into the firm's Active Equity products.
The deal was also structured to include long-term employment agreements for each of Liberty's investment professionals, Goldman said.
Goldman said it expects to close the deal in January 1997.
